page.title: 07ROYAL NAVY AIRCRAFT YARD
page.content: THE ROYAL NAVAL AIRCRAFT YARD FLEETLANDS WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1940 TO OVERHAUL AIRCRAFT AND ENGINES FOR THE FLEET AIR ARM. IN 1967 IT BECAME THE TRI-SERVICE HELICOPTER REPAIR CENTRE AND TODAY DEALS WITH 13 DIFFERENT TYPES OF HELICOPTER. TEST FLYING OF ALL HELICOPTERS REPAIRED IS UNDERTAKEN BY ROYAL NAVAL PILOTS OPERATING FROM THE HELIPAD WITHIN THE YARD. THIS HAS ITS OWN CONTROL TOWER, FIREFIGHTING FORCE AND CRASH AND RESCUE SERVICES. IN 1974 THE YARD BECAME THE OVERHAUL FACILITY FOR THE ROYAL NAVY'S OLYMPUS AND TYNE MARINE GAS TURBINES - THE MAIN PROPULSION ENGINES OF ALL NEW SURFACE SHIPS. THE YARD IS ALSO RESPONSIBLE FOR THE REPAIR OF HOVERCRAFT BELONGING TO THE ROYAL NAVAL HOVERCRAFT TRIALS UNIT.
